summary: This is a sample Experian Credit Profile Report for a consumer named Jonathan Quincy, generated on March 28, 2006. It details his credit history, public records (including a bankruptcy and civil judgment), and contains a fraud victim alert. The document appears to be a template or sample report from Experian's File One system.

events.title: Fraud Victim Alert Placed
events.description: A fraud victim alert was placed on Jonathan Quincy's credit file, warning that fraudulent applications may be submitted in his name or his identity used without consent.

events.title: Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Petition
events.description: A Chapter 7 bankruptcy was petitioned, as indicated in the public records section of the credit report.

events.title: Civil Judgment Filed
events.description: A civil judgment was filed against the consumer in the Southern California District Court, County of Orange, Santa Ana, with plaintiff Allied Company.

locations: Southern California District Court, County of Orange, Santa Ana
keyFacts: The credit report subject, Jonathan Quincy, has a fraud victim alert on his file dated January 20, 2006, warning of potential identity theft.
The report shows a Chapter 7 bankruptcy petition from July 7, 2000, and a civil judgment from October 2003 with plaintiff Allied Company.
The document is a sample Experian Credit Profile Report, demonstrating the format and data points included in such reports, including credit scores, payment history, and public records.
The report lists alternate names (John Smith, Jonathan Smith Jones Jr) associated with Jonathan Quincy's file.
The report was generated on March 28, 2006, at 11:19:56 AM.
